description: Compliance guidelines for OTT streaming platforms operating in Middle Eastern markets including UAE, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain, Oman, and Egypt.

regional_notes.overview: Middle Eastern OTT platforms face strict government oversight. Shahid, OSN, StarzPlay, and international platforms must comply with local media authority regulations. Content is pre-screened or edited for regional compliance.
regional_notes.saudi_arabia: GCAM (General Commission for Audiovisual Media) regulates content. Very strict on alcohol, sexual content, LGBTQ+ themes, political criticism.
regional_notes.uae: National Media Council oversight. Moderate compared to Saudi but still conservative. Dubai more lenient than Abu Dhabi.
regional_notes.egypt: Largest Arabic content market. Government censorship of political content, moderate on social issues.
regional_notes.key_platforms: Shahid (MBC), OSN, StarzPlay, Netflix MENA (with regional restrictions), Amazon Prime Video MENA

Kids (G).description: Family content adhering to Islamic and traditional values
prohibited: ALL alcohol references - even in background
restricted: Mixed gender interaction should be modest
general_requirements: Respect for elders and family structure

prohibited: ALL alcohol - consumption, advertising, positive portrayal
ALL LGBTQ+ content - relationships, identity, themes
Sexual content - even kissing may be cut
Criticism of government or royal families
Immodest female dress (shoulders, legs above knee)

general_requirements: Women characters should be respectfully portrayed

Adult (R).description: Adult content still heavily restricted compared to Western markets
prohibited: ALL alcohol advertising and positive portrayal
ALL explicit sexual content or nudity
Israeli content or normalization themes (varies by country)
Depiction of Prophet Muhammad or companions
restricted: Brief alcohol visibility in Western content (may get edited)
general_requirements: Content may be edited for regional release

alcohol.notes: STRICTLY PROHIBITED in Saudi Arabia and other Gulf states. Content featuring alcohol is either cut, blurred, or entire series may be pulled. Even wine at dinner scenes are problematic.

lgbtq.notes: PROHIBITED. Homosexuality is illegal in most Middle Eastern countries. Any LGBTQ+ characters, themes, or references must be removed. Entire films have been banned for minor LGBTQ+ references.

sexual_content.notes: Strictly prohibited. Even kissing scenes are often cut for regional releases. Nudity absolutely prohibited. Implied sexuality only within marriage context.

religious_content.notes: Islam must be portrayed respectfully. No depiction of Prophet Muhammad. No mockery of any prophets (including Christian/Jewish). Ramadan content has special requirements.

political_content.notes: Criticism of governments, royal families, or ruling parties strictly prohibited. Pro-democracy themes can be problematic. Israel-related content varies by country.

violence.notes: Moderate violence acceptable but gore and torture should be minimized. Terrorism-related content is sensitive.

modesty.notes: Female characters should dress modestly. Revealing clothing, swimwear, and tight-fitting clothes may be blurred or scenes cut.

sorcery.notes: Magic and sorcery are viewed negatively in Islamic context. Harry Potter-style content is controversial. Fortune-telling and occult themes prohibited.

platform_specific_rules.pre_screening: All content should be reviewed for regional compliance before release
platform_specific_rules.editing_required: Content may require cuts or digital alterations for regional release
platform_specific_rules.localization: Arabic dubbing and subtitles required for primary content
platform_specific_rules.ramadan_content: Special family-oriented content during Ramadan is expected
platform_specific_rules.rating_systems: Comply with local rating systems where applicable
